intro: Homalium sarcopetalum, commonly known as the red-flowered holly. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are clustered in inflorescences called cyathia. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy appearance. Homalium sarcopetalum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
